result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian G. Contreras was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adrian G. Contreras is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adrian G. Contreras was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Adrian G. Contreras was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
*Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
*Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
*If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
*Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian G. Contreras

records.addlTxt:
22CF879 and 22CT432 - Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Ben Schwarz.  Clerk: PU

22CF879
 Minutes:  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Counts 2 & 3 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to DE in court. Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 12 months with conditions.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Court may consider expunction upon successful completion.  Appeal Rights given.

22CT432
 Minutes: Case is Dismissed by the State.

Defendant, Adrian G. Contreras, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
